;马来西亚当局表示，他们正在继续调查瓜拉一桩备受关注的事件上周，马来西亚旅游、艺术和文化部长出面干预，“营救”一名据称遭到移民官员勒索的中国公民。

;

;张景星，马来西亚驻马来西亚特使中国本周告诉当地媒体，这起事件并不是孤立的，他过去也曾进行过类似的干预——这引发了人们的疑问：敲诈勒索行为是否在官僚机构的某些圈子中根深蒂固。

;

;中国人驻吉隆坡大使馆表示已了解此事，并“高度重视并尽全力保护在马来西亚中国公民的合法权益”。

;

;马来西亚外交部长阿占巴基 (Azam Baki)反腐败委员会 (MACC) 周三表示，该机构迄今已记录了包括部长在内的 14 人与该事件有关的声明。

;

;阿扎姆表示，这名妇女和她的旅伴被允许进入马来西亚在 Tiong 干预后于周三在一名同事的陪同下离开了该国。

;

;“我们已经找到了据称负责提出要求的中间人，”阿扎姆说，他指的是涉嫌参与该事件的罪魁祸首。寻求贿赂，以允许有签证问题的个人进入马来西亚。

;

;据阿扎姆称，此人受雇于吉隆坡国际机场签约的一家机构，负责处理收到“禁止入境”命令的个人。

;

; p>;

;当地媒体援引阿扎姆的话说：“我们必须彻底调查给予这家公司的合同是否是政府允许的。”

;

;马来西亚的腐败评级停滞不前，许多人仍掌权的被指控领导人

;

;张说，他在收到消息后立即赶往机场，称该名中国公民（一名女性）在下机时“错误”地收到了“不准降落”的命令，然后被迫支付费用贿赂以推翻命令。

;

;他告诉《星报》，上周的事件是他第五次干预涉及中国公民的类似情况。最新一集在社交媒体上疯传，TikTok 上的视频描述了一名部长在吉隆坡国际机场引发骚乱的事件，后来被揭露是 Tiong。

;

;在社交媒体上，对这一事件的看法存在分歧，有人质疑张先生是否越权干预其部门职权范围之外的执法行动。其他人称赞他勇敢地面对腐败行为。

;

;“这不仅仅是做正确事情的问题，而且他敢于揭露已经发生了很长时间的事情，”政治分析人士说James Chin，暗指各部委存在参与敲诈勒索的“卡特尔”。

;

;虽然此事仍在调查中，但以改革主义、反腐败为平台上台的总理安瓦尔·易卜拉欣 (Anwar Ibrahim) – 表示将对拒绝摆脱“旧制度和做法”的官僚采取行动。

;

;马来西亚最新的反腐败行动是否会对安瓦尔政府产生适得其反的效果？

;

;访问吉隆坡国际机场事件发生后的周日，他强调，他并不认为移民部门受到了问题的困扰。不过，他表示，他的突然访问旨在捍卫“整个移民部门的完整性，但仍然强调[必须对一些仍然习惯于旧方式的小团体采取行动”。

;

;马来西亚在透明国际的清廉指数中排名 180 名中第 61 位，几十年来一直在努力应对公共部门的腐败问题。

;

;安瓦尔和其他志同道合的盟友去年上台执政11 月的民意调查是在与该国颇具影响力的巫统党达成协议后进行的，观察家认为巫统是一个马来民族主义团体，对腐败长期采取宽松态度。

;香港当局推出新渠道，供图书馆用户举报不当或不当的图书危害国家安全，支持继续努力下架可能违反本市法律的书籍。

;

;周四，康乐及文化事务署表示，当读者发现“夸大暴力、色情、低俗、违反法律的书籍”时”，他们可以填写所有公共图书馆提供的表格或发送电子邮件。

;

;相关信息，包括书籍的标题、章节、页码和段落，应该部门负责管理该市 71 家公共图书馆，并补充说，收到报告后将采取后续行动，包括将图书馆资料下架以供审查。

;

;该部门负责管理该市 71 家公共图书馆。 p>;

;香港图书质量关注小组召集人、香港最大政党民主建港联盟成员李嘉良对新渠道表示支持。

;

;他说：“此举方便公众监督图书馆藏书，并保证书架上的图书适合各个年龄段的读者。”

;

;但民主党主席卢健熙称此举“没有必要”且“对香港没有任何好处”。

;

;他还担心康乐及文化事务署工作人员会删除所有被举报的书籍，因为没有具体明确的指示让他们判断内容是否危害国家安全或夸大暴力、色情、低俗内容。

;

;“问题书”被扫下香港图书馆的书架，但商店呢？

;

;“这样的举动是有害的”图书馆作为知识和信息渠道的功能。这也破坏了香港社会的开放氛围。”他补充道。

;

;当被问到是否会向员工和公众提供评审书籍的明确指示时，该部门表示：“在收到反馈后，香港公共图书馆会及时审核相关材料。如果这些材料含有危害国家安全或夸大暴力、色情、庸俗的内容，它们将被删除并失效。”

;

;北京于2020年6月对香港实施国家安全法，禁止分裂国家行为，颠覆、恐怖主义和与外国势力勾结。

;

;康乐及文化事务署根据政府审计人员的要求，从5月开始删除可能对国家安全构成威胁的书籍。

;

;洪香港图书馆图书必须通过审查才能重新上架：部长

;

;备受争议的艺术家尊子的作品是首批被禁止的图书之一，他的两篇每日政治漫画专栏于 5 月 14 日被一家主要城市报纸取消。将从图书馆书架上撤下。

;

;书架上不再提供的书籍包括与 1989 年天安门广场镇压、城市政治制度以及反对派人物的任何主题相关的书籍。

;

;但香港政府强调，他们并没有禁止图书，那些通过审查的图书将被重新上架。

;

;行政长官李家超多次为这一有争议的举动辩护，强调图书馆的图书流通必须在不违反法律的情况下“服务于社会利益”。

;香港财政司司长陈茂波表示，香港可以为中国通过提供人才和资金来发展人工智能（AI）技术。

;

;陈周四在上海举行的世界人工智能大会（WAIC）上表示，在当前的地缘政治格局中，香港在吸引人才方面具有优势景观。 WAIC是中国政府举办的年度盛会，旨在向世界展示其人工智能雄心。

;

;“我们想要吸纳研发人工智能的企业人才，”陈说。 “我们的大学汇聚了内地和世界各地的科研人员，香港政府在过去几年给予了很多政策和资金支持。”

;

;陈指出中国的商汤科技领先的面部识别人工智能公司，作为香港在不断发展的人工智能企业中所发挥作用的一个例子。商汤科技由香港中文大学教授汤晓鸥和校友徐立等一批计算机科学家创立，并在香港上市。

;

;中国最大的人工智能会议本周在美国失去了光芒。科技巨头

;

;由多个政府部委主办的世界人工智能大会吸引了一些中国顶尖的人工智能公司和机构。公布的议程主要由当地公司和演讲者主导，一些国际知名人士明显缺失。最值得注意的是，微软支持的 OpenAI（ChatGPT 的开发商）将不会出席。

;

;Chan 补充道，包括香港和珠江三角洲内地城市在内的大湾区 (GBA)形成了“人工智能从研发到市场应用的全产业链”。谈及香港的金融优势，陈表示，大湾区就好比“结合了美国纽约湾区和旧金山湾区的优势”。

;

;陈表示，香港的金融优势进军金融科技为中国乃至世界发展人工智能，特别是生成式人工智能技术提供了经验和教训。

;

;“我们决定推动Web3在香港的发展，但前提是保护好投资者，不将该技术用于洗钱等非法目的，并确保金融体系的稳定。”他补充说，人工智能的挑战在于是否建立了“适当的围栏”来保护人类。

;

;陈先生于周三抵达上海，参观了领先的人工智能公司商汤科技的办公场所。

;

;另外，香港数码港与临港集团签署协议，临港集团是一家专注于工业园区开发和投资的国有企业。上海人工智能高地临港新区在会上深化“战略合作”。

;美国财长耶伦对中国进行为期四天的访问被视为这是继国务卿安东尼·布林肯上个月访问北京之后缓解双边紧张局势的最新尝试，此次访问因二月份的气球事件而推迟。

;

;但拜登政府的最高财务官员在其任职期间将讨论什么在中国？

;

;

;

;北京方面广泛提及的一项要求是取消美国前总统唐纳德·特朗普在 2018 年征收的惩罚性贸易关税，因为取消关税被认为对两国都有利。< /p>;

;中国驻华盛顿大使谢锋周一在会见耶伦时要求美方高度重视解决贸易和经济问题，称这是中方的主要关切。

;

;这一需求引发了人们对美国商务部长吉娜·雷蒙多或其他高级官员也将于今年晚些时候访问中国的猜测。

;

;北京也对美国不断升级的科技限制深感担忧。

;<除了将数百家公司列入贸易黑名单外，美国从10月起禁止向中国销售高端芯片，并向荷兰和日本施压，要求其停止销售高端芯片制造机。

;

;此外，中国当局早些时候对美联储快速加息表示担忧，美联储的加息旨在抑制美国通胀，但也给新兴市场带来沉重压力。

;

;中国两周前下调了政策利率以帮助支撑经济，目前正面临资本外流和人民币稳定的新考验。

;

;美国的目标是什么？

;<美国财政部已经表示，耶伦将讨论“作为世界上最大的两个经济体，我们两国负责任地管理我们的关系、就关切领域进行直接沟通以及共同应对全球挑战的重要性”。

;

;长期以来，中国一直认为她务实，愿意在金融和经济事务上进行合作。

;

;分析人士认为，可以讨论中国在全球债务减免和气候目标中的作用，而其对稀有金属出口的禁令、倾销美国国债以及外汇制度的不透明度（美国财政部 6 月份的报告中提到的问题）也可能会被提上议程。

;

;史蒂芬·奥尔森 (Stephen Olson)，辛里奇基金会高级研究员表示，此次访问是建立所谓“护栏”过程中的一步，以帮助防止双边关系进一步恶化。

;

;“这是美国的一个关键目标，更多”他说。

;

;奥尔森还表示，在美国总统乔·拜登和中国国家主席习近平可能在亚太经济论坛上举行会晤之前，华盛顿希望“确保一切顺利”。 11 月在旧金山举行的亚太经合组织 (APEC) 论坛。

;

;谈判可能产生哪些结果？

;

;中国分析人士普遍怀疑为期四天的会议是否会取得任何具体成果

;

;不过，此行有助于改善双边进一步交往的整体氛围。

;

;“北京大学国际政治经济学教授查道炯表示：“为期四天的访问的讨论很可能是双方在单边或共同关心的问题上直接、充分地阐明自己的立场。”

;

;“如果耶伦访问导致中国同行宣布对华盛顿进行互访，这对双方和第三方来说都将是一个积极的成果。”

;

;这次访问会让美国-中国关系重回正轨？

;

;基尔世界经济研究所教授罗尔夫·兰哈默表示，耶伦的授权有限。

;

;“她可以让天空稍微晴朗一点”并创造合理的氛围，但即使在经济和金融领域，安全问题也盖过合作问题，成为重中之重。

;

;辛里奇基金会的奥尔森警告说，市场不应过度解读这次访问以及全面恢复高层对话。

;

;他补充说，华盛顿的政策将继续基于这样的假设：中国是一支决心篡夺美国领导体系的全球破坏性力量。< /p>;

;但奥尔森补充说，中国的政策也将继续基于美国决心阻止其崛起的假设。

;

;“耶伦会议期间发生的任何事情都不会从根本上改变这些政策计算，”他说。

;即使出现“恐慌”，中国也有充足的工具来稳定外汇市场根据中国央行支持的《金融新闻》的评论，随着人民币兑美元汇率延续跌势，人民币前景受到影响。

;

;中国人民银行 (PBOC) 设定了每日汇率周四人民币兑美元汇率定于7.2098，强于预期，引发了对北京即将出台政策支持的猜测。

;

;该定盘价限制了在岸人民币双方​​2%的波动，并且经常被使用市场参与者衡量官方对外汇市场的立场。

;

;自今年年初以来，人民币兑美元汇率已下跌 4.7%。

;

;评论，周三晚间发表的声明重申了北京方面的立场，即中国经济复苏将继续改善，人民币计价资产仍然对投资者有吸引力。

;

;该声明也是在美国财政部长珍妮特·耶伦 (Janet Yellen) 抵达开始第四轮经济对话的前一天发表的。周四对中国进行为期一天的访问。据中国财政部称，她预计将与高级官员会面。

;

;中国可用的工具包括外汇风险准备金率、银行外汇存款准备金率、用于确定外汇储备的逆周期因子。评论称，央行每日参考利率和跨境融资宏观审慎因素调整。

;

;多年来中国外汇市场的一系列改革，带来了更多的对冲工具和更多的跨境融资。中国人民银行支持的文件补充道，“越来越多的外国投资者正在用真金白银表达对人民币资产的青睐，表达对中国市场长期发展的信心” ”，评论称。

;

;自去年初以来，由于经济表现疲弱和美元走强，中国资本市场出现大量资金外流。

;

;分析师普遍预计，中国人民银行将再次降息以促进经济增长。

;

;“通胀下降，加上国内复苏势头放缓，可能会促使中国人民银行在 6 月份降息以刺激经济，”牛津经济研究院周二表示。

;

; p>;

;“虽然中国正在采取措施加强经济复苏，但宽松的货币政策对其货币来说并不是好兆头，尤其是在美国利率将进一步上升的情况下。”

;

;随着中国的百万富翁不断离开，资金外流可能“比平时更具破坏性”

;

;瑞银首席中国经济学家王涛认为，央行不需要直接干预外汇市场，但会通过调整等措施来释放稳定信号。人民币对美元汇率中间价，启动逆周期调节因素，加强对跨境资本流动的控制。

;

;短期来看，中美利差可能会带来压力。人民币，但她表示，人民币的整体表现可能与经济复苏的步伐挂钩。

;

;“如果（中国）降息与其他强有力的稳定增长政策相结合，以促进“随着中国经济增长的稳定和复苏，那么它对人民币汇率的影响应该是非常积极的，”王周二对总部位于北京的中国金融40人论坛智库表示。

; Thu, 06 Jul 2023 18:20:02 +0800 In India, a gay marriage case at the supreme court could fuel gold rush in nation’s wedding industryhttps://www.scmp.com/news/asia/south-asia/article/3226776/india-gay-marriage-case-supreme-court-could-fuel-gold-rush-nations-wedding-industry?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.06 18:00;
;;

;When India's Supreme Court started hearing a case to legalise same-sex marriage earlier this year, matchmaker Kamakshi Madan suddenly received an increase in enquiries from parents seeking spouses for their LGBTQ children.

;

;“I had mothers calling me looking for husbands for their sons,” Madan, a specialist matchmaker for the LGBTQ community, said by phone from the western Indian city of Pune.

;

;A ruling to allow same-sex couples to marry would be a huge boost to the LGBTQ wedding industry in the country of some 1.4 billion people, where families often spend the equivalent of tens of thousands of dollars on lavish ceremonies that can last for several days.

;

;Indians spend a fifth of the total wealth accumulated in their lifetime on their weddings, according to loan provider Reliance Money, in a trillion-rupee (US$12 billion) industry.

;

;Some same-sex couples have been tying the knot unofficially since India decriminalised homosexuality in 2018, exchanging vows before families and friends in unrecognised ceremonies.

;

;If India legalises gay marriage in the coming months, it will become only the third place in Asia to do so, after Taiwan and Nepal.

;

;The government has said it opposes recognising same-sex marriage and urged the Supreme Court to reject challenges to the current legal framework lodged by LGBTQ couples. A ruling is expected this year, though the court has not announced a date.

;

;Inspired by Bollywood celebs, modern Indian brides fight sexist wedding rituals

;

;The issue of gay marriage is sensitive: speaking openly about homosexuality is taboo for many Indians.

;

;But attitudes are shifting: 53 per cent of Indian adults say same-sex marriage should be legal, found a June report by the Pew Research Center, a US polling and research organisation.

;

;Previous Ipsos polls found 29 per cent supported same-sex marriage in 2015 and 44 per cent in 2021.

;

;Madan, whose clients call her “the LGBTQ+ Sima auntie” in reference to the popular Netflix reality show Indian Matchmaking, said she has witnessed growing acceptance among parents and families first-hand.

;

;“I have had a father from a (conservative) background call and say, 'Please find a bride for my daughter',” said Madan, who set up her matrimonial and counselling company Aarzoo in 2018.

;

;Saurabh Bondre, a Sanskrit scholar who officiates non-legally binding traditional Hindu weddings for gay and lesbian couples, said legalising same-sex marriage would assuage priests' fears about legal disputes or boycotts.

;

;“Many professional Hindu priests are actually not against performing such weddings. They are fearful of a backlash from within the priest community,” Bondre said. “If you perform a same-sex wedding, you may not get (invited to carry out) straight weddings afterwards, costing you your livelihood.”

;

;Bondre, who is a member of the LGBTQ community, said many same-sex couples wanted traditional religious marriage ceremonies, in line with cultural norms.

;

;“We see our uncles, aunts, cousins and friends reiterating their love for each other,” he said. “We also dream that we will have a similar commitment.”

;

;New, conscious Indian weddings aim for no more waste – or patriarchy

;

;Sameer Sreejesh, founder of LGBTQ matrimony app Umeed, said the Supreme Court case had prompted a rush of LGBTQ people across the country to openly admit their sexual identities and seek life partners.

;

;The app's daily downloads had doubled since the marriage equality court hearings began on April 18, he said.

;

;“We're adding more than a hundred members every day, even though we're spending less than before on ads,” Sreejesh said.

;

;Umeed currently has about 20,000 registered members and 5,000-6,000 active members daily.

;

;Though the app makes a small profit of a few thousand rupees a month from memberships, Sreejesh anticipates huge growth.

;

;“If the verdict comes in our favour, there are millions of people waiting,” he said.

; Thu, 06 Jul 2023 18:20:02 +0800 Buoys over troubled water: Chinese hi-tech helps researchers monitor ‘pulse of Pacific Ocean’https://www.scmp.com/news/china/science/article/3226558/buoys-over-troubled-water-chinese-hi-tech-helps-researchers-monitor-pulse-pacific-ocean?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.06 18:01;
;;

;The Kuroshio extension is one of the fastest moving ocean currents on the planet. Each second, the flow, which stretches into the western Pacific Ocean from the eastern coast of Japan, moves enough water to fill more than 2,300 large sports stadiums.

;

;The warm waters of the tropical current also release a massive amount of heat into the atmosphere, which not only produces extreme weather locally, but affects the climate of the entire northern Pacific region.

;

;Studies have shown that the changeable nature of the Kuroshio extension has contributed to the formation of typhoons that affect China's coastal areas The current also intensifies storms that track eastward towards the US west coast, bringing heavy rainfall, strong winds and other weather impacts.

;

;Cooperation on marine protection can reduce South China Sea tensions

;

;The unpredictable and sometimes violent nature of the Kuroshio extension have earned it a reputation in the scientific community as a graveyard of buoys.

;

;One particularly destructive incident happened on May 19, 2020 when a storm hit the Kuroshio Extension Observatory, snapping the floating marine monitor free of its anchor.

;

;Similar accidents have happened over the years. In 2017, the unmanned observatory went adrift for two months, leaving nearly 5,000 metres (3.1 miles) of cable and many expensive sensors on the sea floor.

;

;For decades, the United States was the only to country maintain continuous observation in the region. When the Kuroshio observatory went down, though, the data collection stopped.

;

;But this time the American buoy wasn't the only one slammed by bad weather. Not far away, two buoys from the China Kuroshio Extension Observatory (CKEO) were also wobbling in the heavy rain and high waves. The buoys were similar in size and complexity but hardened in many ways.

;

;They survived the turbulence without a scratch and continued streaming data in the absence of the American observatory, according to a peer-reviewed paper published in the journal China Science Bulletin on June 26.

;

;The US is a leader in ocean monitoring, but China has been catching up. In recent years, Chinese researchers have deployed a growing number of high quality monitoring devices, particularly in marine areas where the strategic interests of the two nations overlap.

;

;“By 2022 the CKEO buoys had been conducting continuous observations in situ for more than three years. An enormous amount of data has been collected,” said the Chinese research team led by professor Chen Zhaohui, from the Ocean University of China in Qingdao, Shandong in the paper.

;

;The rapidly moving current of warm water is also a concern for China's military. Submarines, for instance, can experience unexpected jolts due to sudden changes in water density.

;

;“This is an area with the most complex conditions and the strongest ocean-atmosphere coupling in the world,” Chen said in the paper.

;

;The US and other countries that have lost large buoys in the region may have underestimated the challenges. The hull of the American Kuroshio buoy, for example, was constructed of glass fibre and filled with foam.

;

;Such materials were unlikely to be strong enough to deal with some of the most extreme conditions in the Kuroshio extension, the Chinese team said.

;

;The Chinese buoys, however, employ a magnesium-aluminium alloy in the frame. “The material is chosen for its rust resistance, high strength and low density. The overall strength of a buoy made with this alloy is higher than that of commonly used foam-filled buoys,” Chen's team said.

;

;The mooring system of the CKEO buoys has been designed to withstand maximum flow rates at different depths, extreme wind speeds and wave conditions, according to the Chinese researchers.

;

;The anchoring cable is not directly tied to the buoy's main body. Instead, a cantilever structure extends from the bottom of the buoy under the water, a design that not only reduces the risk of breakage, but also helps maintain the buoy in a relatively vertical position even in the most violent waves, the researchers said.

;

;After the American buoy was yanked loose in the Kuroshio extension in May of 2020, it took the US almost two years to replace it, according to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.

;

;By then, China had installed five submerged observatories to work together with the two surface CKEO buoys, forming a near-straight line of observational sites across the current from the south to north.

;

;Chen, who could not be reached for comment, said in a press release in 2021, that putting permanent observatories in the Kuroshio extension was like tapping the pulse of the Pacific Ocean.

;

;“Just like our human blood vessels continuously transport nutrients to various parts of the body, the Kuroshio and its extension are crucial marine areas for the global climate system. The ocean releases heat to the atmosphere through the Kuroshio, which acts as a massive 'warm air channel',” he said.

;

;“Five years ago, this area was still unknown to us. But now we have established the world's first real-time, fixed-point observation array for the Kuroshio extension,” Chen said at the time.

;

;With a single-point observation from the US buoy, researchers can gather valuable data on specific oceanic conditions at that particular location. However, the limited coverage may not provide a comprehensive understanding of the larger-scale processes and dynamics in the region, according to a Beijing-based marine scientist who is not involved in Chen's project.

;

;The Chinese buoys, which cover an entire section of the region, provide a more extensive and comprehensive view of the oceanic conditions and processes in the Kuroshio extension.

;

;The broader coverage allows researchers to capture a more complete picture of the spatial distribution, temporal variability and interactions of various oceanic parameters, such as temperature, salinity, and currents.

;

;In practice, marine scientists might prefer combining the data collected by the American and Chinese buoys, which would allow for a more robust analysis of the oceanic processes and their interactions with the atmosphere, according to the researcher who requested not to be named because of the sensitivity of the issue.

;

;While there is no official cooperation agreement between the US and Chinese governments, project scientists from both sides do have mutual access to some of the data collected by these buoys.

;

;Malaysian marine group leads charge to preserve climate-resilient seagrass

;

;The combined data can help researchers identify and study large-scale phenomena, such as oceanic fronts and eddies, and their impacts on climate systems. A broader perspective enhances the accuracy and reliability of scientific research and modelling efforts in the Kuroshio extension area.

;

;“China and the US have joined hands in keeping an eye on this troubled water for the sake of mankind,” the marine scientist said.

; Thu, 06 Jul 2023 18:20:02 +0800 JPMorgan and HSBC are top workplace choices for business students while Hong Kong government is first pick for engineering students, survey findshttps://www.scmp.com/business/article/3226769/jpmorgan-and-hsbc-are-top-workplace-choices-business-students-while-hong-kong-government-first-pick?utm_source=rss_feed

;Hong Kong universities' business and commerce students have voted JPMorgan and HSBC the top two employers as potential jobseekers prioritise “a friendly work environment” over higher salaries, a survey by a talent advisory firm published on Thursday showed.

;

;The survey, conducted between October 2022 and April 2023, interviewed 4,179 students from nine universities in Hong Kong pursuing degrees in business, commerce, engineering, natural sciences, humanities, liberal arts and education. It also revealed that students' expected annual salary upon graduation fell 3 per cent to HK$292,900 a year or about HK$24,400 per month, reflecting the weak outlook in the face of the current economic slowdown.

;

;The survey was conducted by Universum, which is part of Nasdaq-listed investment firm StepStone Group. It was part of an annual global survey conducted by the firm, whose focus is on employer branding, to gauge career aspirations and preferences of Hong Kong's next-generation talent.

;

;JPMorgan and HSBC retained their top positions from 2022, and in 2023 they were followed by Morgan Stanley, which jumped three places from the previous year. Google and the Hong Kong government rounded out the top five positions, respectively.

;

;They were ahead of bigger firms like Apple and Google, but they both received a more favourable response from engineering and natural sciences students. Although the Hong Kong government slipped by a spot in its rankings among business and commerce students, it was voted the most ideal employer by engineering and natural sciences students for the fourth straight year.

;

;“We are seeing young talent in Hong Kong prioritising work environment and career development over financial earnings and salary, a trend that can be seen in many of the more developed markets worldwide,” said Mike Parsons, managing director of APAC for Universum.

;

;Why Hong Kong finance firms are looking for environmental science graduates

;

;“Tomorrow's workforce are highly motivated by acknowledgement and growth opportunities that enable them to feel valued and included in their community, with financial compensation often coming second,” he said.

;

;This year, students ranked “a friendly work environment” their top preference, continuing the trend from 2022, the survey showed. “Professional training and development” and “encouraging work-life balance” were the next two factors that mattered most when seeking employment.

;

;On the other hand, “high future earnings” was ranked lower than the previous year, declining by two places to fourth position. This reversed the trend of 2022's survey, when students expected a 19 per cent increase in annual salary in comparison with 2021 levels.

;

;This highlighted the shift in expectations from students, as they increasingly prioritised personal well-being over higher financial earnings, according to Universum.

;

;It also reflected the preference for job security as “students are likely aware of the shift away from the Great Resignation period and into a less certain economic environment where high-profile lay-offs are more common, and hence are more prudent in their salary expectations”, the survey said.

;

;Hong Kong's economy pulled out of recession earlier this year, supported by local consumption, but exports remained anaemic. April exports totalled HK$338.3 billion, down 13 per cent from a year ago, and worsening from the 1.5 per cent drop experienced in March.
